text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Government orders more soldiers into Bekaa Valley to implement decisions to muzzle calls for civil disobedience and restore law and order.
- Tired and frustrated, ceasefire monitoring committee adjourns until Tuesday.
- Birds at dump, closed to Beirut airport, peril to aircraft.
- U.S. delegation plans to do business in Beirut.
- Amnesty angered by Israeli jail cover-up.
- Arafat and Hariri in war of words over Israel.
- Hariri says there will be no war in region and Highest Lebanese-Syrian Council will meet soon.
- Israeli shelling of areas in south Lebanon.
